intro: Galedupa elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leaf galedupa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Galedupa elliptica is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
